uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Interface Shader

All Known Implementing Classes:
MetaShader, MultiPointHSVShader, RampShader, SimpleShader, satShader
public interface Shader

An interface to be used by shaders. Shaders define color sceems for use in maps

They work by returning a colour for any given value.

How they work out what that colour should be is down to each shader to work out for itself.

A very simple example is that of the monoShader which simply returns the same color every time regardless of the value passed to it.

Shaders are probably THE easyest and most useful thing for others to write if they want to add to the geoTools package.

Method Detail

getRGB

public int getRGB(double value)
Gets RGB colour for the given value.
Parameters:
value - A double that the shader should look up and return a colour for.
Returns:
an int RGB of the colour.

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(double value)
get the color that reprisents this value
Returns:
the color for this value

setMissingValueCode

public void setMissingValueCode(double code)
Set the code that represents a missing value. Many data sets have missing values in them represented by a code, my using this method you can tell the shader what that value is. e.g. Arc/Info often uses -9999
Parameters:
code - The double used to represent a missing value.
See Also:
setMissingValueColor(java.awt.Color)

getMissingValueCode

public double getMissingValueCode()
Gets the current code used to represent a missing value. Many data sets have missing values in them represented by a code, my using this method you can ask the shader what value it is currently using.
Returns:
The value used to represent a missing value
See Also:
getMissingValueColor()

setMissingValueColor

public void setMissingValueColor(java.awt.Color color)
Sets the color used to represent missing data values.
Parameters:
color - The color to return when getColor/getRGB are passed a missing value code
See Also:
setMissingValueCode(double), getRGB(double), getColor(double)

getMissingValueColor

Returns:
The color that represents a missing value

Parameters:
